column1: full toss swinging down the leg side and Hope can't glove it cleanly! Five wides!
136kph, shorter length wide of off, he's jumping back and pushing this past backward point wide of third man, should be two, Warner wants it but Finch says no
139kph, full wide outswinger, he throws the hands at a square drive slicing it through the vacant gully to third man
over-steps! It hooped back in and might have trapped him LBW if he didn't hit it! He might have got a touch on it
length ball, he cracks it flat to wide mid on, Brathwaite makes a superb diving save to knock it down and save four!
good length, wide of off, he is happy to leave through to the keeper
137kph, shorter length, extra bounce, Finch tries to cut but is beaten by the bounce
141kph, good length top of off, he defends on the front foot to wide mid off and calls yes immediately for a good single
137kph, full swinging into the pads, he flicks this powerfully in the air but it lands short of Russell at deep square
135kph, back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot but point swoops to prevent any potential one
back of a length angled into leg, it comes off the thigh pad, hurried him, but it runs behind square for a leg bye
high full toss wide of off, 132kph, he chops a square drive wide of third man for a couple
141kph, shorter and wider, he's back and lat cutting straight to backward point
139kph, short ball into the ribs, Finch plays an awkward but controlled pull shot around the corner
136kph, good length shaping away, his feet are stuck in concrete and he has a huge swipe and miss at a booming drive

caught behind! Cracking delivery! Good length, angled in towards off stump, he's forced to defend half forward, it nipped off the seam, scratched the outside edge and a simple catch for Hope! What a beautiful piece of fast bowling! That first over is a distant memory now!
143kph, lifting delivery down leg, he went to glance and withdrew the bat, it's a wide but there's a plan
142kph, good length, angled across, he defends on the front foot, slightly away from his body
143kph, fuller, he just pushes this past the bowler for four! The timing is ridiculous. He blocked this straight of mid in and it ran all the way for four!
139kph quick bouncer, he shaped to pull and bailed out as it got big. Tight wide call but it was over head high
hits him in the grill of the helmet! Bang! This was a brute! It was a short lifter, he was jumped and fending, it went past the gloves and hit the grill of the lid! Wow
144kph, good length outside off, he's forward and defending with an open blade, running this to third man
back of a length on off, 137kph, he's jumping back and across and working this neatly behind square for a single
134kphm good length, top of off, he defends coming forward a touch late
139kph, full on leg stump, he clips this through square to the sweeper
short of a length, he's back and across, squared up a touch but defending well
133kph, full on leg stump, he clips this elegantly through square leg to the boundary rider
141kph, bouncer outside off but too high and called wide

caught at backward point! He was hanging back a touch because of the bouncer, it was a length ball wide, he tried to square drive on the up, didn't get on top of the bounce and just bunted a catch to Hetmyer at backward point who is in quite close! Cottrell salutes!
142kph, good length, middle and leg, he defends from the crease
139kph, good length outside off, he drives on the up but mistimes it dragging it to mid on
beaten by one that nips away off the seam, Hope fumbles the take and allows a bye
138kph, back of a length, he is back and across and working this wide of fine leg, Cottrell sprints around and fields brilliantly to prevent a second run
cracking bouncer and he tries to pull coming off the toe of the bat and it drops short of second slip
pulled in the air fine! There's a leg slip in for this short ball in the ribs, he gets the front knee up Brian Lara style with no control and pulls it in the air fine and it races to the rope
shorter length, off stump, he's back and across, defending solidly
shorter length, he's back and across, he defends into cover, they want one but it's not on
good length, outside off, he's back and across and defending
good length, angled across, he's back and opening the face to run to third man
back of a length, outside off, he's back and across, he defends to point
back of a length, off stump line, he's defending off the back foot
short and wide, 137kph, he cuts nicely but straight to the man at wide third man
142kph, good length, top of off, he defends off the back foot back to the bowler
play and miss driving at a wide fuller ball. It was a tempter on the angle and Khawaja's feet were anchored as he threw his hands at it
136kph, cracking short ball, he pulls taking his eyes off it but middles it wide of fine leg and they get two
he's hit on the body trying to pull again! He got threw the shot too soon. Great bowling. He doesn't look comfortable

caught behind! A screamer from Hope! A one hander! The short barrage unsettled him. This was full angled across, he backed away to try and drive on the up, got a thick edge, Hope dived full length to his left in front of first and plucked it one handed! It would not have carried to Gayle at slip! Superb stuff from the Windies!
good length, shaping back in, he's back and across and defending
short ball, 138kph, down leg and he withdraws the hands. It's called wide
short and wide, 138kph, he's back and cutting nicely wide of third man
136kph, back of a length, he's punching to cover-point

skied straight up! Caught by Hope! Maxwell out pulling second ball! This was another excellent bouncer, very high and well directed, he tried to pull and skied it straight up, Hope wanders underneath it and takes a simple catch! Another salute from Sheldon.
137kph, shorter length into the hip, he's jumping back and squared up, gets a leading edge along the ground to cover
beaten by 137kph, length ball angled across. He was caught on the crease and beaten all ends up.
142kph, good length, top of off, he's back and across and working it to midwicket
136kph, bouncer, very high, he ducks under it easily
143kph, lifter angled into leg, he steps inside the line and takes his hands out of the way to leave it
141kph, shorter length into the ribs, he's back and across and riding the bounce working it to backward square
shorter length, 141kph, angled down leg and called wide
thigh high full toss, he clips this powerfully straight to backward square
bouncer, too high and called wide
139kph, good length, he's back and defending to cover
128kph, good length, angled in, he defends to midwicket with the angle
full toss, a gift, he just eases a check drive straight of mid on! That was a terrible delivery and Stoinis was very happy to receive it
130kph, good length, wide of off angling in, he leaves it alone
124kph, good length, it bounces a touch, catches the shoulder of the bat and balloons well short of point
back of a length, 129kph, he's back and across and working it to midwicket
hooked fine of deep square! it was only 130kph, head high, he swivelled on a hook shot, hit it in the air but well wide of deep square, one bounce four
full toss, Smith drives with ease straight down the ground! Another gift. 50 up for Australia
137kph, back of a length, he's back and across with so much time to work it behind square
140kph, short bouncer wide of off, and it's called for height
137kph, short lefter, outside off, he defends away from his body, knocking it down
143kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he pushes away from his body off the back foot to backward point
short ball, 140kph, over off stump, he sways back and drops the hands to let it pass
138kph, lifting short ball, he jumps up to defend in front of his face and knock it down
130kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and across and defending into the off side
127kph, wide of the crease, angled into middle, he's back and across and working through square leg to the sweeper
131kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and forcing to cover
126kph, back of a length, middle and leg, he is back and glancing this around the corner
131kph, bouncer, he ducks under it early
short and wide, 131kph, Smith is back and square driving magnificently through point! Class shot from a class player
132kph, fuller length, middle stump line, he pushes on the front foot to mid off
132kph, half volley outside off, he is slow to move forward, driving back to the bowler
driven in the air low past the bowler! it was full, he checked a drive, it was just out of reach of Holder in his follow through and it raced past the diving mid off fielder
Classical on drive! Glorious. Too full, too straight, Stoinis presents the full face and punches straight down the ground
good length, off stump, he defends on the back foot into the off side
back of a length, 138kph, he's back and defending into the off side
back of a length, wide of off, he's back and across and defending
129kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and across and glancing this to fine leg
shorter length, he's back and knocking this close into the leg side and they pinch a well run one
133kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it with ease
angled way down the leg side and called wide
127kph, another bouncer, he ducks under it again but it wasn't that high
130kph, chest high short ball, he pulls with control behind square to the man in the deep
short of a length on fifth stump, Smith hops up on his toes after shuffling across to cover the line in defense.
short on the body, Smith moves across to get inside the line and rolls his wrists over a pull to long leg.
short of a length on the hips, tucks it through square leg.
fullish length on fourth stump, Smith moves across to defend to midwicket.
bouncer angled down leg, Smith ducks, lucky not called a wide on the line.
good length ball on off, Smith with another shuffle across to flick it behind square.
good length ball angled into leg stump, Smith misses a flick and the ball caroms toward backward point.
fullish length on fifth stump, Smith slaps it back toward Brathwaite moving left in his follow-through.
short of a length on fifth stump, Smith tries to tip and run in front of point but Stoinis wasn't interested and Fabian Allen swoops in to keep Smith honest.
bouncer on off, Smith ducks it with ease.
short of a length on off angled into the body, bit of extra bounce and defended to midwicket.
fractionally short of a length on fifth stump, Smith with an elegant back foot punch beats extra cover to spoil a maiden.

sucker ball snares a wicket for the captain! Holder bowled it a touch short on off stump angling into Stoinis. It sat up there for him waiting to be spanked but Stoinis neither rolls the wrists over it nor gets requisite elevation to clear Nicholas Pooran in the ring at midwicket. Straight to him at chest height. West Indies rollicking start with the ball continues.
fullish length angled across on fifth stump, comfortably left alone.
short on off stump and takes off with extra bounce, shoulders arms to leave.
short of a length again, wider on fifth stump again and left once more.
fullish length on fifth stump again, still not tight enough to make Carey use his bat.
short again outside off, Carey leaves a fifth consecutive ball to complete a wicket maiden for Holder.
full on off stump, pushed down the pitch and cut off by mid-off.

my goodness this looked stone dead live, given not out and Holder calls for the review! It was full and angled into Carey, who is forced into playing at the ball for the first time. Beaten playing around his pad and struck on off stump at first view. Indeed it's a red light on impact but he's hit just above the knee roll and ball-tracking shows Brathwaite's height generates enough bounce to clear the stumps by two inches. West Indies lose their review. Umpire Chris Gaffaney's sharp decision is upheld.
good length ball, Carey goes back to defend this from off stump into midwicket.

inside edge and nearly ricochets back to Brathwaite for a return catch! Fullish length ball and Carey leaves a slight gap between bat and pad, the ball takes the inside edge prodding forward and balloons up over the pitch but Brathwaite opts to keep his elbows clean instead of putting in a dive. It lands about two yards short.
short ball outside off, left alone.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended in front of point who swoops in to field.
full on off, driven to mid-off.
full on fourth stump, driven back to the left of Thomas and he knocks it down in his follow-through.
good length on leg stump, flicked off his pads but straight to square leg.
short of a length on fifth stump, shuffles across and punched off the back foot to mid-off.
short of a length and angled well down leg for a bonus run.
short of a length on middle and leg, some bite off the pitch as Smith tucks it behind square with a hand coming off the bat, diving stop by Pooran at backward square in the ring to deny a single.
bouncer angled well down leg, could've been called a wide on height or the line. Either way, it's a free run.
short of a length on off, tapped with soft hands to mid-off.
short of a length outside off, defended to point.
short on middle, Carey gets on his toes to defend it with soft hands into the ground.
good length but angled across fifth stump, Carey continuing to leave these alone.
good length ball tighter on fourth stump line draws Carey into a forward defensive prod into the covers.
short on leg stump, Carey seizes on the line to tuck this off his ribs behind square and he's finally off the mark on his 15th ball. Mock applause from some in the crowd.
short on the stumps, Smith ducks but the ball doesn't bounce as much as expected, barely clears him.
yorker on off stump, nudged to extra cover.
fullish length on sixth stump, shoulders arms again.
short of a length on fourth stump, Carey gets up to guide this with soft hands past slip to third man.
good length ball on off, Smith goes back and across to defend to mid-on.
overpitched on leg stump, flicked to deep square leg.

ooohhh, nearly another! full and wide on sixth stump, Carey finally tempted to drive outside off for the first time after so many leaves and spoons an uncontrolled drive that barely clears the fielder. The crowd thought Pooran at backward point was in play.
short of a length angled into off stump, defended to Holder.
good length ball angled in on fourth stump, defended to point.
short of a length on off, defended on the back foot to midwicket.
short on off stump, Carey hops up to defend with soft hands to backward point.
short again on fourth stump angled in, goes back to defend into the pitch.

short on off, Carey once more forced onto the back foot to defend. Holder makes him play at every ball with the around the wicket angle after Carey was leaving everything comfortably with the bowlers going over the wicket and it results in a maiden.
fullish on leg stump, clipped out to deep square leg.
fullish length on fourth stump, Carey using his bat a bit more now drives firmly but Evin Lewis with a good diving stop to his right at extra cover denies a boundary.

tight! But a controlled shot to be fair and clears gully by two yards. Thomas short of a length on off, Carey buckled his knees to create room to elevate this ball and just undercuts it enough for his first boundary
bouncer on fourth stump, left alone.

surviving dangerously yet again! Full on off stump, Carey doesn't get over the top of a drive toward mid-off, it carried for the longest time before bouncing just short of Holder at mid-off before going under his slide on the ring and it skids away.
short on middle, defends an inside edge into his feet and Smith calls for a run from the non-striker's end as the ball dribbles behind point for a sharp run.
short on off, defended into the ground off the back foot.
short on fifth stump, enough width for Carey to feel comfortable throwing his arms at this and flays it high over point, super shot.

carbon copy ball and nearly identical placement. Carey gets over the top of this one a bit more and hits it a touch squarer too in the air over point, still nowhere near the off side ring. Cottrell releasing the pressure here.
fullish length on off stump, tapped with soft hands into the off side and they scamper through.
fullish length on the pads, bread and butter for Smith flicking through square leg.
overpitched outside off, leans into a drive, all timing along the ground through cover. A trifecta of boundaries for Carey in the over to make up for a very timid start.

dropped! Cottrell eaten by the turf trolls on the boundary! Holder bounces Smith and he can't control this hook as it sails toward long leg. Cottrell circles around running 20 yards left but takes a very poor angle and is on the verge of over-running the chance. He tries to change direction late and loses his footing with a clumsy slip and slide. The ball lands a foot in front of him grasping forward in vain. Should've gotten two hands to it at the very least. Smith survives!
full on off, clipped through midwicket, excellent running and Lewis can't deny the third running across the rope from deep square leg.
full angled across fourth stump, Carey sucked into a prod when he was leaving these earlier, beaten past the edge.
short on the stumps, tip and run in front of point.
short of a length on off, Smith shuffles across to tuck this in front of square leg.
fullish length on fourth stump, defended to cover.
good length ball on off, clipped to the leg side.
bouncer on off, ducks under it.
good length on off, tapped with soft hands behind the stumps and Gayle is not able to deny a sharp single running forward from slip .
bouncer again angled across off stump, Smith ducks under it comfortably.
short of a length on fifth stump, Smith punches off the back foot, thick edge goes to third man.
another bouncer to end the over, Carey sways under it.
good length ball on fifth stump, Smith defends to mid-off.
full on fourth stump, driven firmly but wide enough of Nurse at mid-off to allow a single, diving stop to save a boundary though.
luscious! Fullish length outside off, gets the head over the ball driving past Lewis at extra cover. Carey starting to hum now.
full again on fourth stump, another firm drive but this time picks out Lewis on the ring at extra cover.
short of a length on the hips, goes back and clips it with one hand off the bat down to deep fine leg and they complete an easy pair.
angled across fifth stump on a good length, left alone.
nearly a wicket first ball! Full outside off, Smith reaches out to drive through cover and drags an inside edge past the stumps.
pulls out the reverse sweep straightaway and connects beautifully! Floated on fourth stump, calculated shot hitting with the spin turning away from the lefty and smokes this behind point.
uses his feet and converts this into a low full toss on middle stump driving to long-on.
full and very wide outside off, driven to extra cover, diving stop by Russell. Smith misses out on a boundary.
full on off, flicked across the line to midwicket.
full on off, driven through cover to the sweeper Pooran.
full on fourth stump, prodded through point to the sweeper.
full on off, driven to mid-off, Holder.
fullish length on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg, Lewis.
short on the stumps, Carey ducks, ball didn't bounce that high, 76 mph delivery.
short on fifth stump, Carey gets on his toes to uppercut wide of the keeper, cut off by Cottrell at third man on the rope for a pair.
short again angled into the body, this time Carey goes for the pull and rolls his wrists over to drill this behind square, cut off well on the rope by Nurse.
full on off stump, Smith reaches forward to defend to cover.
full on off again, Smith flicks across the line to Nurse's right, who dives and bats this toward Pooran at cover to deny a run.
short of a length on off, backs away to cut behind point.
short outside off and spinning away, Carey tried to swat that wide of midwicket but Russell dives to turn four into one.
full on leg stump, driven to long-on.
full on off, quicker ball at 57 mph, Smith nudges in front of point for a quick run.
129kph, full, driven back to the bowler
129kph, good length, nipping back, he's covering up in defence
132kph, good length on off, he pushes this slowly to mid on who is back on the circle and they take an easy one

caught behind! Dre Russ does the trick! 132kph, good length, angled across and running away off the seam, Carey caught on the crease, pushes away from the body and gets a thin edge through to Hope! Huge breakthrough that for West Indies.
139kph, good length tailing he leaves and it nearly lights up off stump! So close to hitting!

attempted pull pops up but falls safe! Like Maxwell he takes on the short ball second ball, gets onto him way too quickly, pops up off the top edge but it lands safely behind square as the keeper and forward square converge
full toss on leg, he clips it to forward square
full and tailing in, he drives towards mid off
131kph, shorter into the hip, he's tied up, trying to work to leg, he gets a leading edge, it pops up but lands safely again
130kph, bouncer, seemed quicker, he ducks underneath it well enough
133kph, full and tailing into off, his head falls a touch, he squeezes it off the inside edge onto pad and rolls away, Smith is aware and calls him through
back of a length, climbs and blows his glove off the bat handle! He reacted theatrically as that reared from a length. He knocked it down OK
133kph, good length, top of off, he drives on the up to point but it's well cut off by Pooran to keep Coulter-Nile on strike
full, a half-volley, he drives wide of mid off and goes with the stroke, Holder makes a good diving stop to save multiple runs
very full, he sits back and whips it to wide mid on but can't beat the man
bouncer, not as much bounce as earlier, he ducks under it easily
132kph, back of a length, some extra bounce, he's back and across and defending
132kph, back of a length, some width offered, he caresses a lovely back foot drive through the vacant cover region, it runs over the practice pitches and they get three
138kph, good length, angled down leg, he closes the face early, gets a leading edge that runs through gully
incredible squeeze down the ground! It was almost a yorker, he jammed the bat down and timed the pants off it, it raced past the stumps, straight of mid on and ran away
shorter length, he pulls in the air but well enough over midwicket for a couple
138kph, sprayed way down the leg side
good length, off stump line, he pushes on the front foot to mid off
flicked in the air just fine of deep backward square! 140kph, half volley angled down leg, he flicked it high in the air but it was in the gap between fine leg and deep square and found the rope
shorter into the hip, he pulls well with control wide of fine leg
good length, fifth stump line, he tries to cut but is too close to it and plays over the top of it
111kph short slower ball outside off, he sits and waits and waits and misses the cut shot
hooked fine! 137kph well directed bouncer, he takes it on and gets the hook off the top edge and it flies fine of fine leg for four
high bouncer, 132kph, and rightly called wide. Way too high
another bouncer that is way too high
launched high over mid on, miles in the air but he didn't time it well enough to find the rope, it pitched well short and he gets two
140kph, cracking yorker, tailing into middle, equally well dug out
138kph, back of a length on off, he chops it off inside edge onto pad and it rolls away into the off side, Smith is awake and he pinches one
130kph, attempted yorker, on off, hint of shape, he chops down on it and runs it behind point for a single
nearly caught down leg but it just fell short! Shorter length down leg, he gloved it trying to glance fine but it just bounced short of the diving Hope
good length, 127kph angled across, he leans back and flays a back foot drive straight to cover
short and wide, he late cuts off the bottom edge fine of third man and a horrible misfield allows four!
Shorter length, he's back and defending into the off side
133kph, good length, he pushes on the up to mid on on the circle, takes on Brathwaite's throw, he hits but Smith was nearly past the stumps
136kph, back of a length, extra bounce, he's surprised a touch driving off the back foot to mid off
slower ball, wide of off, 123kph, he's back and working this with supple wrists behind square
An LBW appeal but he might have got an inside edge. Not out is the call. It was angling down and might have been too high
hooked in the air but into the gap between fine leg and deep square! It wasn't controlled but it found the gap again
slower ball outside off, he swings hard, dragging a mistimed strike through midwicket for a couple
short ball, he swivels inside the line, rolls the wrists and controls this down to fine leg
137kph, full outside off, he swings hard and gets a thick inside edge past the stumps and it flies down to fine leg
good length, angled into off, he pushes from the crease to cover
136kph, shorter length, angled down leg, he steps inside and tries to pull fine but misses. It's not a wide. Good call. Almost over leg
back of a length outside off, he forces off the back foot through cover-point and they get an easy two
shorter length, into the chest, he's inside the line, tucking it behind square for a single
136kph, angled down the leg side and called a wide
good length, angled into off, he defends with soft hands into the off side and they pinch one
138kph, back of a length, he pushes off the back foot to backward point
slower ball, 116kph, he defends from the crease
high bouncer, he tries to hook fine but is beaten by the bounce. Not called wide
flicked over square leg! A gift. Length ball on the pads and he picks it up and flicks this over deep square into the crowd!
135kph, angled into the pads, he's taken on the pad and it rolls away
135kph, high bouncer, he pulls, not in control but he didn't thrash at it, and the lack of power ensure it dropped well short of deep square
full on leg, he's back and knocking this behind square
drifting across, shorter, he's back and late cutting to short third man
drifting outside off, he pushes off the front foot with an open face to short third man. Gayle wanders across to field and gets a huge cheer
full on middle, he drives back to the bowler
tossed up, he drives powerfully but Nurse fields well in his follow through
driven firmly to long on
very full on middle, flicked to long-on.
low full toss on the pads, wristily flicked over midwicket, beats deep square leg trying to cut it off.
slower ball lands full on fourth stump, keeps the hands back to slice this fine to third man on the rope.
fullish length on off, pushed to point.
fullish length angled in on fourth stump, guided with an open face to third man.
full on leg stump, clipped square to deep fine leg.
fullish length on fourth stump, pushed through the covers.
full on leg stump, whipped through midwicket.

nearly a runout! Good length ball on the legs tucked off the pads to the man at 45 on the ring, Smith called for a single immediately. Coulter-Nile was ball-watching before setting off, barely beats the relay as Nurse fumbles the collection.
full and driven to extra cover.
quicker ball full on middle stump, defended.
flighted on off at 58 mph, driven to long-off.
good length ball on middle, slower delivery at 111 kph/69 mph, flicked straight to midwicket.
bouncer down leg, called wide comfortably on the line. 20 wides now in the innings.
short of a length on fifth stump, flashes at it and a thick edge goes well wide of Shai Hope fine of third man to the rope.
fullish length on off, shuffles across and whips through midwicket.
slower ball on off stump on a good length, pulled high over midwicket, not timed well but lands safely between deep square leg and long-on, it brings up Coulter-Nile's maiden ODI fifty!
tasty buffet bowling! Shin high full toss on middle, Coulter-Nile drives through the line scooping it well over the rope at long-on.
good length ball angled into off stump, guided with an open face to third man.
shuffles across his stumps, flicks a scoop fine past Hope. Coulter-Nile growing in confidence.
fuller and quicker down leg, 21st wide of the innings.

dropped! Hetmyer shells it! Quicker ball lands short on middle, flat pull by Coulter-Nile didn't get the elevation to clear Hetmyer at deep midwicket. He comes in 12 yards from the rope and slides on his knees to cushion the take but it ricochets out. His body wasn't balanced as well as it could've been.
full on off, driven to long-off.
full and wide, drives in the air wide of long-off for an easy pair.
full on the legs, clipped to deep midwicket.
full and spinning past the legs. 22 wides and counting....
fullish on fourth stump, Smith charges and checks a push through cover.
full outside off, lofted drive over wide mid-off. Elegant!

Cottrell with a screamer! No turf trolls eating him up this time at long leg! Fullish length on a fifth stump line. Smith shuffles across once more to flick this high over backward square, Cottrell made an absolute mess of a chance on 26 in an identical slot, this time sprints along the rope 20 yards moving left at full speed and stabs at it with his left hand, knifing it out of the air, then flicks it up before stepping over the rope before reclaiming it after reestablishing himself inside the field of play. 10 out of 10 for sure!
wide yorker, too wide to play at.
length ball outside off, again just outside the guidelines and evades the drive from Coulter-Nile.
short outside off, flat-batted to long-on.
short on fifth stump, Cummins sways away.
fullish length on fifth stump, Cummins wafts and misses.
yorker on off, dug out back to Thomas.
full on the legs, flicked to Gayle at short fine leg, swan dive to stop and gets on his knees to soak up the adulation from the crowd.
fullish length angled into off stump, chopped off the back foot to third man.

dropped! Very harsh but it did ricochet off Brathwaite's hand at deep square leg and then hit the rope on the full for six. Shortish length on off stump, Coulter-Nile laces a scorching pull toward Brathwaite at deep square leg, just evades his grasp running to his left and sliding at the last moment. After the take that Cottrell just had in the previous over, the fans and teammate's must be wondering why Brathwaite couldn't match him! But it was 10/10 on the degree of difficulty scale.
highest score now by a No. 8 in a World Cup! In the slot outside off, drives through the line 15 yards into the stands over long-on.
short outside off, slapped to long-off.
fullish length outside off, pushed to extra cover, good stop by Nurse moving left to keep it to one.

slower bouncer, Cummins struggles keeping his hands back going to pull, skies it to deep square leg, Cottrell settles under it 10 yards in from the rope. This was 3/10 on the difficulty scale compared to the absurd one-hander he took to dismiss Smith.
full and very wide, dips the back knee to get under this and carve it over extra cover. Exquisite.
slower ball lands too short, sits up at 67 mph and scorches a pull between deep midwicket and deep backward square.
wide yorker, dug out to long-off.
bouncer, beaten hooking.
slower bouncer this time, bottom edges a pull down the leg side collected by Hope.
wide yorker, inside edge dragged to Gayle at short fine leg.
full and wide, thick edge driving but it doesn't carry to Hope.
another wide yorker, dug out off the toe to long-off. Coulter-Nile checks the toe of his bat to see if it has 10 more runs in it to take him to a maiden ODI ton.
short on the body, goes to pull, off the glove before bouncing short of Hope. Does well to save four.
very full on the legs, clipped behind square, relay comes in from long leg running right.
full and wide, driven in the air toward Hetmyer at mid-off, he dives right to knock it down but not cleanly enough to prevent a second run. It means Coulter-Nile will be on strike for the next over.

full and wide, Coulter-Nile misses a drive, but Hope fumbles the take. Universe Boss makes a galaxy sprint from short third man to relay back in. He's holding his left hammy now. Given as runs by the umpire instead of byes.

Coulter-Nile falls four short of breaking the record for a No. 8 in ODIs! It was in the slot outside off, he went for glory trying to clear Holder at wide long-off but got under it just a bit too much. The bat turned on connection too so wasn't timed as well as he wanted. In the air for awhile before coming down to the West Indies captain three yards inside the rope.
slower bouncer, Starc is early trying to pull at 78 mph.
another short ball, this time Starc crunches it sweet through midwicket.
bouncer on the body, late hooking. No wide called on the line down leg. Ball passed over leg stump.

Brathwaite rewarded for pitching it up again, in the slot on off, Starc tried to heave it over Holder at wide long-on but didn't get under it enough and the tallest man on the field has no issues claiming this one roving left a few yards inside the rope at chest height.
good length and swinging down leg, it curls back to Carey at head height and he fumbles it all the way to the rope for five wides.
good length on the legs, clipped behind square.
good length on the legs again, flicked to long leg. Cut off by Zampa.
short of a length on off, no swing, defended on the back foot.
short and very wide outside off, left alone, just inside the guidelines.
full on the stumps, defended.
fullish length on fifth stump, no swing, left alone.
fullish length angled across fourth stump, Lewis shoulders arms.
fullish length on fourth stump again, this time sucked into a flat-footed drive, beats the edge.
overpitched on off, touch of swing in, driven to mid-on.

lovely lines from the start by Cummins rewarded! He was probing away consistently on that fourth stump line. This one holds its line on fourth stump going across instead of swinging in, angles across Lewis on a good to fullish length at 86 mph, Lewis prods with a diagonal bat angle and the ball clips the edge flying to Smith's right at second slip, taken at thigh height crouching into a mini-slide to cushion the take.
full on the legs, whipped straight to Coulter-Nile at midwicket. Gimme ball and couldn't put it away.

stays low and nearly bowled! Good length ball pitching on about fifth stump and angled in, Hope goes back and it doesn't bounce as much as he thought it would at 86 mph, the ball coos into the ear of off stump. No kissing though...
good length on off, defended to cover.

nearly a catch! Short and wide, Gayle rocks back to cut, it was in the air for awhile, but Stoinis is a bit too square at cover for the chance, he dives right to knock it down at the very least on the short hop.
short outside off on fourth stump, Gayle goes to pull and plays over the top of it.

another one clips the edge but goes safe over Carey! Rip-snorter from Starc! Short ball angled into the body from off stump, Gayle tries to get the hands behind it on the back foot and it climbs sharply , clips the shoulder of the bat and takes off over Carey's leaping effort to the rope.

given out but Gayle reviews immediately! Fullish length on fourth stump angled in, Gayle is late driving as there was a definite noise when it passed the stumps... because the ball has in fact shaved off stump. A little peck! The baby smooch! Not a full pucker to dislodge the bails though. Incredible!
short and wide outside off, too wide to play.

yorker nails Gayle on the toes and he's given out but Gayle challenges umpire Chris Gaffaney's judgment once more with a review! It was tailing in and hits him on the front pad ricocheting to the back foot, initial impact was showing it was tailing down leg. Sure enough ball-tracking shows the impact was outside leg stump and continuing to go down. Gayle survives again.
good length ball defended to point.
fullish length on middle, clipped to long leg.
mini charge from Gayle to a full length ball on off, carved over mid-off. Gayle brings up 1000 runs in World Cup matches.
length ball on middle, Gayle heaves this over midwicket. The crowd roars with delight.
another length ball angled a touch wider on off, heaves across the line again but doesn't time it. More of a top edge that swirls safely over mid-on for a pair.
short outside off again, Gayle rolls the wrists this time over a pull and creams it wide of mid-on.
full on the legs, clipped to square leg.
full and angled across middle and off at 90 mph/146 kph, pushed back down the pitch.
short and well down leg, Carey does well to save it from being five wides.
full on the legs, clipped to long leg.
yorker on leg stump, stabbed out behind square and they come back for an easy pair as deep square leg who was quite fine circles around to relay it in.

stone dead this time around! Starc couldn't pierce Gayle with the yorker on the previous ball but this time around Gayle is late getting the bat down on an 86 mph delivery pitching very full and hitting him low on the shin in front of middle. After waiting 12 seconds while chatting with Hope, Gayle finally calls for the review.... Ball-tracking confirms it was clipping leg-stump on umpire's call. Three strikes (on DRS) and you're out! West Indies retain their review though.
fullish length on fourth stump, defended behind point.
good length jagging back on middle, Hope cramped for room trying to get this away.
full on fourth stump, strong forward stride driving to extra cover.
bouncer angled down leg, Hope looks at square leg for the height but it's not called wide on that or on the line.
full on off, driven to mid-off, acrobatic stop on the ring.
bouncer again, angled at the body, Hope ducks again.
short of a length on off, defended into the ground.
overpitched on fifth stump, lovely flourish from Pooran to get off the mark with a sweet drive through the covers.
overpitched tailing into middle at 89 mph/144 kph, flicked wide of mid-on, dragged back at the rope to keep it to two.
overpitched and tailing into middle again, Starc continues to search for the yorker at 93 mph but Pooran is up to the task whipping it past Coulter-Nile at square leg in the ring.
short of a length on off, defended on the back foot to cover.
short of a length on off again, guided with soft hands to backward point.
fullish length on off, driven to mid-off.
full on off, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
short of a length on off, punched off the back foot to Stoinis again in the covers. Diving stop with his right hand.
fullish length on off, flicked off the back foot wide of mid-on.
short angled across off, goes to pull but nubs this into the ground to midwicket.
short on off, sits up at 85 mph/136 kph, swatted with disdain over midwicket. Authoritative pull.
Coulter-Nile screams 'hit me!' once again with the same length. Short on off, sits up for a punishing pull over wide mid-on.
fullish length on off, chipped to mid-on.
short of a length on off stump, clipped off the hips to square leg.
fullish length ball, Hope takes a step forward to heave over mid-on, inside edge caroms into the box. Hope grimaces with a wobbly shuffle toward point. He'll be feeling that for the next few overs...
good length ball on middle stump, Hope shuffles across to clip to square leg.
bouncer, clears him ducking easily.
full on off, almost yorker length, stabbed out to point.
full on off, defended down the pitch.
short of a length on off, Pooran fights it off with his hands chopping it down behind the stumps.
good length on the legs, clipped to midwicket.
short on off, pulled along the ground to deep midwicket.
fullish on middle, flicked off the back foot through midwicket.
edge! Short of a length from Coulter-Nile clips Hope's back foot poke, it flies wide of slip to third man.
short of a length into the body, defended to short midwicket.
short on the stumps, defended to point.
bouncer, wide called on height.
bouncer again, another wide called.
short on the body this time, Hope uncomfortable trying to pull, can't get it away.
short on off, Cummins is giving Hope a real working over here. Hops back looking skiddish here trying to bat it down into the ground.
short of a length and angled way, way down leg.
short of a length on off, defended behind point.
short on off stump, extra bounce as this one pings Hope on the gloves before the ball flutters into the off side. He survives a testing over from Cummins.
full on the legs, clipped through square leg.
short outside off, plenty of time for Pooran to rock back, cuts in front of point. Zampa sweeping on the cover rope tries to slap it back in vain.
full angled into middle stump this time, driven firmly through cover, this time Zampa has to track 25 yards to his left to cut it off, saving the fourth run.
flighted on leg stump at 57 mph, clipped to deep midwicket.
short on fourth stump, punched off the back foot to cover sweeper.
short outside off on fifth stump, slapped to extra cover.
good length on the legs, clipped through midwicket.
the short ball attack on Hope continues. Bounced and goes to hook Coulter-Nile, gloves it and the ball balloons over vacant short fine leg.
good length on off, punched off the back foot to cover sweeper.
good length ball on fifth stump, defended to backward point.
bouncer again to Hope, beaten trying to hook at 84 mph. He's not shown much sign of seeing this off with confidence.
short on the body, a bit more convincing this time around with the pull and keeps his wrists rolling over it along the ground to square leg.
full on the legs, goes to sweep and is late, hit on the pads but pitching outside leg results in a stifled appeal from Maxwell.
fullish length on leg stump, goes back to clip to midwicket.
short on the stumps, punched to mid-off.
full and driven to cover.
short of a length outside off, punched to the cover sweeper.
short on leg stump, Hope backs away to carve through the off side to the sweeper.
short of a length on off, punched off the back foot to cover sweeper.
full on off stump, Pooran onto the front foot to push to cover.
full on the legs, misses a flick, goes off the pads down leg side, diving stop by Carey saves four leg byes.
fullish length on fifth stump, Pooran tries to flat bat this over mid-on but the ball doesn't come on, goes under to Carey.
good length on fourth stump, punched off the back foot wide of backward point to third man fielding very square on the rope.
short on the stumps, pulls it into the ground to square leg, slight misfield to allow the run.
drifting in leg, it comes off pad and runs behind square for a leg bye
very full, this drifts a long way and yorks him outside off, he misses

A review for a run out at the non striker's end. This was driven firmly back at the bowler, Zampa reached down to his right, got a touch and it went onto the stumps but Hope was back comfortably. It is not out.
dropped at cover! Barely a chance to Maxwell. He saved four really. This was cracked hard to Maxwell's right, he dives and knocks it down with the right hand and it runs away for a single
good length, he chops it into the pitch and it bounces up, Carey knocks it onto the stumps but Hope is back
quicker, drifting in, he defends into the off side
128kph, good length on middle, he defends back to the bowler
hooked fine off the top edge for six! This was a well directed bouncer, he hooked but got a top edge, fine leg is square and it carried all the way for six
good length, top of off, he defends into the off side
131kph, good length fourth stump line, he pushes this through point to the sweeper
shorter bouncer, 129kph, he pulls with control from in front of eyes to deep square
133kph, bouncer, it's reasonably high, calls for a wide from the crowd but the umpires ignore them
drifting into leg, 88kph, leg break, he defends towards midwicket
tossed high and wide of off, he mistimes a drive to cover
low full toss, he yorks himself, digging it out to cover
drifting into middle and off, he defends into the off side
cracked off the back foot through cover! Seized the length quickly. It was fractionally short and he is back in a flash, giving room and punching this past Smith at cover and away to the rope
low full toss, he drives firmly to long off
fuller length angled into off, he drives off a thick inside edge to mid on
132kph, low full toss, he drives off the toe end of the bat to mid off
133kph, good length, top of middle, he's caught on the crease but whips it fine to fine leg, it was awkward but effective
132kph, back of a length, on leg, he defends this towards midwicket
back of a length on the hip, he tucks this behind square
pulled wide of fine leg! Chest high short ball is easy pickings for Hope. He rolls the wrists and gets it in the gap between fine leg and deep square

caught at backward point! A one hander from Finch! Brilliant catch. It was full and drifting away from Pooran, he tried to drive with a flourish down the ground, sliced a thick outside edge high to backward point, Finch ran back and reached up with the left hand and it stuck! He didn't get a long way off the ground Finch, but he held on!
shorter length, on leg, he's back and working this through square leg
wrong un, he's back and tucking this fine from middle stump
he's back and pulling a ball that isn't that short, he mistimes it through square leg to the sweeper
beaten by a brilliant wrong un. It was beautifully flighted and it spun past the groping edge
tossed up, he drives firmly along the deck to long off
fast full toss on off, he's back and defending
146kph, attempted yorker, tails down leg and comes off the pads and runs fine! Carey nearly reached it but it was too quick
137kph, bouncer, he ducks and falls backwards! That was a sharp bouncer
134kph, climbing into the ribcage, he rides the bounce, works it behind square
143kph bouncer sprayed down the leg side
146kph, full on leg stump, he clips it neatly to midwicket
137kph, back of a length, he defends off the sticker from the crease, knocking it down
top spinner, outside off, he strides forward to defend into the off side
shorter wide of off, he's back and cutting straight to backward point
wrong un on middle, he defends on the front foot
drifting outside off, a half-volley, he cracks a cover drive straight of the sweeper on the rope to pick up two
flatter on middle, he's back and pushing this straight of midwicket, there is probably one there but they turn it down
flatter leg break, he's back and punching to long on
140kph, fuller and tailing into middle and leg, he clips this neatly but straight to midwicket
138kph, good length, well wide of off, he's happy to let this go through to the keeper
powerful pull shot! Wow! 142kph bouncer, he stood up, got on top of the bounce and smashed it through midwicket along the ground like a tracer bullet
half-volley outside off, he cracks a drive firmly straight to mid off
140kph, short and wide, he cuts but picks out backward point
attempted yorker, 146kph, turns into a full toss on middle, he clips this behind square to the sweeper
shorter length, he's back and pulling firmly to deep midwicket
juicy full toss and he is smashed through square leg! A genuine freebie and he flat batted it forward of square to the short boundary
tossed up outside off, he drives straight to cover
drifting into middle, he defends with bat onto pad, Australia appeal for LBW, but it's not out and they don't review
drag down, cracked in the air just past midwicket and Coulter-Nile misfields on the rope at long on! That was smoked but Coulter-Nile will be disappointed he allowed four.
shorter and slower, he's back and pulling this straighter to long on
132kph, back of a length, he stands up and punches off the back foot to deep cover-point
short ball, he pulls this powerfully behind square but straight to the sweeper
another short one, 134kph, he pulls along the ground to deep square leg
133kph, back of a length, he's taken on the thigh guard and it drops into the off side
pull shot smashed in front of square! Another bouncer, he stayed leg side and swung hard and smacked it forward of square to the short boundary!
good length, top of off, he pushes this towards mid off with minimal footwork
full and drifting into off, he yorks himself, dragging a drive to midwicket
he slices a drive wide of cover and it runs to the sweeper in the deep
beaten by a big spinning wrong un. He didn't pick this as he stretched forward to defend
full on leg stump, he drives back to the bowler
play and miss at a shorter wrong un. He tried to cut this but was beaten by the bounce
hammers a sweep behind square! Too full on leg and in the arc, didn't matter if he couldn't pick the wrong un, he got down on one knee and clubbed it along the ground behind square
back of a length, he pulls from outside off, straight to midwicket
angled down leg and he glances fine for four! Bad ball from Coulter-Nile. Easy enough to just glance it fine with the angle and the pace
glorious cover drive on the rise! Not a half volley, he strides out and drives sumptuously through cover with superb timing
bouncer, wide of off, he ducks down under it
138kph, short ball, he pulls without too much timing forward of square but into the gap and it's a decent chase for the sweeper
133kph, short ball, he cracks a pull along the ground to the sweeper
tossed up on leg and he defends

mix up and a run out! Shorter outside off, he gives room and punches wide of mid off, Hetmyer takes off at the non-striker's but Hope stops running, sends him back, Cummins swoops and throws to Maxwell and Hetmyer is stranded! Hope might have cooked his partner there.
tossed up on off, he drives back to the bowler
shorter length, he's back and punching back to the bowler
drifting across the right hander, he reaches out and pushes this through point to the sweeper
flatter on middle, he pushes this back to the bowler
cut behind point and it races away! Just a hint of width and slightly short, he thrashes it past short third man and the sweeper at deep point can't cut it off
tossed up leg break, he drives firmly inside out through cover-point to the sweeper in the deep
top spinner, he's back and defending covering off stump
full and driven hard straight of long on, Khawaja gets around and makes a diving save on the rope, he saves two
tossed up outside off, he square drives through point to the sweeper
full toss, he drives along the ground to long on
flatter on middle, he's defending from the crease to midwicket
flatter but gets some over spin to kick up, he is forced to defend
on leg stump, he works this to midwicket but can't beat the man in the circle
full on middle, he tucks this to midwicket again and Smith cuts it off

Huge LBW appeal and given! Holder reviews. From around the wicket, this was tossed up, Holder went to sweep. It looked to pitch in line. No bat involved. Ball tracking says pitching just outside leg! Decision is overturned! It looked in line live. It was millimetres outside. Great review
tossed up, he drives firmly to mid off
132kph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends with soft hands to the gap at cover-point
pulled over deep midwicket! Landed just short of the rope! Fractionally short, he was back in a flash and picking this up and depositing it over midwicket powerfully.
shorter into the hip, he's back and across, glancing this to fine leg
short ball, 132kph, he tried to pull but got it off the toe of the bat towards mid on
off cutter, 125kph, it bounces a touch, he defends from the crease
134kph, back of a length, he's back and running this to third man
angled across, a touch of width, he's back and placing this cut behind point very nicely for a couple
flatter on off, he's back and forcing towards long on but Maxwell cuts it off
quicker outside off, he gives room to cut but mistimes it
very full, he yorks himself, working it to midwicket
shorter length, it sits up and he punches this past cover for two to the sweeper
tossed outside leg, he paddles fine off the edge and it runs away for a couple
good length outside off, he's forward and pushing off a thick inside edge
pulled in the air for a long time but it falls just short of Starc on the rope! He was looking into the sun so may not have been able to pick up the trajectory early
beaten by a back of a length ball outside off, he tried to open the face and run to third man
good length, top of off, he defends from the crease
pulled fine for four off the gloves! It was a short ball, down leg, he pulled of the gloves, it flies fine and Lyon, on as a sub, misfields diving on the rope
another bouncer, he tries to pull but is beaten by extra bounce
edged through a vacant slip! It was flatter and shorter wide of off, he cuts but gets a thick outside edge that runs away to third man
drifting wide of off, and driven beautifully through cover-point! The placement and timing with lovely hands was something to behold.
tossed up, he drives down the ground to long on
shorter length, he's back and punching to mid off
shorter length, he's back and cutting to deep cover-point
tossed up outside off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
good length ball on off, driven to mid-off.
short of a length on off, guided with an open face to third man.
short of a length on the hips, tucked into the leg side by Holder. We're now under 100 for the West Indies to win...
good length on off stump at 81 mph, kept out on the back foot by Hope.
fullish length on off, driven firmly to mid-off.

leg stump half-volley and he chips it to mid-on! Hope wanted to work this through square leg but he gets a leading edge that balloons to Khawaja on the ring at mid-on. After surviving the short ball barrage from Cummins at the start of his innings, he gets out to a fairly innocuous ball. The pendulum swings back towards Australia!
full on off, defended on the front foot.
slightly short on off, punched to cover off the back foot.

floated into the legs, goes to sweep and after a very very long appeal, given out! If Holder had the Maxwell lbw overturned you can bet he was gonna go to DRS on this and after a chat with Russell he does. He's hit fairly low on the back leg bending forward missing the sweep. Impact was barely in line with leg stump and once again this is overturned. It didn't look promising live and umpire Palliyaguruge has this overturned, missing leg stump comfortably. Both umpires are having a shocker today.
full on off, driven to cover.
short on middle, Holder goes back to flick through the leg side.
quicker ball flat on middle, Russell sees it safely off the back foot.
full on off, defended.
fullish length pitching on off and angling across, Holder goes back and it beats the edge.
overpitched outside off, Holder with little footwork driving and beaten again.

short ball, top-edged for six! Starc confused Holder with a change of pace on the body at 129 kph/80 mph, went to pull and it clips the top edge and sails over Carey, 7 yards over the rope at long leg.
bouncer on the legs, Holder ducks under.
very full, attempted yorker after the bouncer but not full enough, driven down the pitch and mid-on cuts it off.
full and wide outside off on sixth stump line, driven firmly to the cover sweeper.
lift-off for Dre Russ! Floated full on off, Russell winds up and scorches this into the stands a good 20 rows back over long-on into the second tier.
quicker ball zipped in short and flat at 62 mph, blocked back off the back foot.

flighted again full on leg stump, Russell takes a half step back to clear the front leg and slams this flat into the rope flush in front of the sightscreen. Umpire changes his call to a four after help from TV replays, to more groans from the pro-West Indies crowd. Maybe fractionally short hopped the padding.
low full toss pushed back to Zampa.
floated on the legs full pitching outside leg, Russell steps away to make room and scuffs a drive to long-on.
full on fourth stump, Russell backs away and misses a booming heave with his head falling away. Holder comes down the pitch to have a chat and rein him back in.

Russell steps away from leg again and Starc follows him with a short ball on the body, cramped for room he misses a pull ducking his head. Whatever Holder said didn't seem to have much impact on Russell's approach.

Russell backs away from leg and Starc follows him too far down leg, misses a pull off his hips, clips the thigh down to long leg, sliding stop by Coulter-Nile at the rope saves it from being four leg byes.
fighting fire with fire! Attempted yorker tailing away from Russell backing away from the stumps, it was heading straight for middle but Russell drills it past mid-off for a boundary.

Russell's fiery cameo ended by Starc! And a brilliant take by Maxwell too! Russell continues backing away from leg stump for a mow over midwicket, Starc targets leg stump and Russell gets a leading edge skier over point. Maxwell runs out from the circle taking this over the shoulder a third of the way to the rope. Sensational grab, 8/10 on degree of difficulty but it was bog standard for Maxwell. Whatever Holder said to Russell at the start of the over to have him rein in his aggression failed to produce the desired effect from the captain. Totally unnecessary from Russell at this stage.
good length on the legs, clipped through square leg.
fullish length on fifth stump, misses a flat-footed waft.
short of a length into the ribs, misses a short-arm pull.
good length on off, defended.
fullish length on off, defended on the back foot.
length ball angling into off, heaved over midwicket with power.
fullish length outside off on sixth stump line, tame flat-footed waft by Holder beats the edge.
short on the legs, chipped very nervously over midwicket to long-on.
floated full outside off, firm drive by Holder screeches past Smith at short extra cover and beats long-off to the rope.
full, almost yorker length on sixth stump, Holder plays over the top with a drive.
good length on fourth stump, straightens and Holder defends to extra cover.
full on fourth stump, Holder prods tentatively and an edge goes through vacant slip before racing away!
full on fifth stump, Holder reaches forward with a good stride and pokes a thick edge to backward point.
good length ball angled in from off stump, Brathwaite jams his bat down belatedly and the ball skids off the ground and bounces over the stumps. Hands on head from Coulter-Nile.
so close! Good length ball on off, Brathwaite swats across the line, leading edge flutters just above Coulter-Nile's leaping effort. Fingertips!
full on off, guided behind point.
full outside off, Holder drives and gets another thick edge through vacant slip. Finch with conservative captaincy and the ball is cut off at the third man rope.
good length ball, Brathwaite hops back to defend this off middle stump to point.
fullish length on fifth stump, Brathwaite hops across the stumps to defend, struck on the pads but well outside the line of off stump.
nearly another drag on! Good length ball angled into off stump, little footwork and a poke produces an inside edge lodged in between his feet.
short offcutter on the legs at 73 mph, pulled comfortably to long leg.
another bouncer, this time full speed at 83 mph, fought off behind point.
good length ball with plenty of width, Brathwaite flashes outside off and is beaten.
very full on off stump, Brathwaite tries to whip this through midwicket and a leading edge skittles along the ground to mid-off.
bouncer on the stumps, Brathwaite leaps to fight this off with his gloves. Greeted with nervous oooohhs from the crowd.
short ball, goes to pull and is beaten.
good length ball on off, guided well wide of third man on the rope behind point and they come back for an easy two.
slower short ball on off, Holder struggles to keep the hands back, bottom edged pull goes off the thigh.
short ball at full pace this time sits up on the off stump line, laces a ferocious pull on one bounce to cow corner, 50 up for Holder at a run a ball. Can he finish off the chase?
Brathwaite has officially joined the party! Another bouncer, wide outside off, Brathwaite has to drag this a long way to get it over midwicket, but that's pure muscle on the pull and it sails away.
good length ball on fourth stump, opens the face to run it to third man.
short on off, Brathwaite goes to pull again, flat bats this over mid-off. Not timed well at all but straight enough to be safe from picking out Finch on the ring.
short again, clear plan here, once again doesn't middle it but clears Warner by about 5 yards on the ring at mid-on. Australia sniffing closer here...

nearly a runout! At both ends! Fullish length ball driven to mid-on. Warner fields and fires at the non-striker's end, would've been out by 3 yards if it hit but was wide by 2 yards. Cummins fields the miss mid-pitch and throws to Carey, nearly nabs Holder but he's just in by 4 inches. Replay shows Carey knocked the bails off without the ball in his hands.
fullish length on off, defended to the off side.
bouncer, Holder cramped on the body, fends this off to silly point.
bouncer on the body, goes off Holder's shoulder to fine leg. Didn't really play a shot but the umpire deems it to be evasive action and a leg bye is given.
fullish length on off, guided off the back foot in front of point.
good length ball on off, guided to short third man.

slower ball brings a wicket! It was an attempted yorker with plenty of pace off it, met by Brathwaite at shin height as a low full toss, but completely miscues it off the toe of the bat high over mid-on. Finch backpedals 10 yards back and to the left before taking it with ease. The tension rises a few notches. Can Holder shepherd the tail across the line?
yorker on off stump, dug out off the toe to Starc.
full toss at knee height wide outside off on sixth stump, Holder fans over the top of it nervously. Fingernails being chewed intensely in the crowd.

Starc is winning this for Australia! The pressure looked like it was getting to Holder after missing out on a meaty full toss the previous ball. Starc follows it up with a bouncer on the leg stump line, he goes to pull but is late and it thuds off the gloves. The ball balloons to Zampa at short fine leg, he only needs to take three steps forward from the ring to claim this at chest height.
yorker on fourth stump, Nurse plays over the top, ball just misses the off stump.
bouncer on the body, Nurse turtles his head out of the way.
now a charge from Nurse. Stoinis saw it coming and pitched it full as Nurse ran down the pitch backing away from leg stump and he swings over the top with his head flying up.

low full toss into the pads, huge lbw shout given not out. Double-noise for sure. Australia decides not to review. And with good reason, inside edge off the pads with the ball taking a carom to point.
full on the legs, clipped out to long leg.
yorker speared into the legs, dug out to long-on.
an absolute meatball of a full toss at thigh height on about sixth stump, Nurse flails wildly and misses badly. Second full toss West Indies have missed out on vs. Starc in the last two overs.
yorker speared into the legs, misses a flick and the ball ricochets to point.

yorker makes it five for Starc! Man of the Match just about locked up for him turning this chase haywire for West Indies. Cottrell backed away trying to make room over the off side but it was full and straight and shatters the stumps.
full and beaten.
full and defended.
yorker barely kept out to deny Starc a sixth to end the match.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
slower ball yorker on off stump at 78 mph, defended.
full on middle, driven to cow corner, they turn down the single with 33 needed off 9 balls now. They're not exactly swinging for sixes here....
full on the stumps, driven back to Stoinis.
short on the stumps, pulled to deep midwicket, sliding effort denies four after a carom from Coulter-Nile to Maxwell.
full on off, pushed into the off side, again they turn down a single. 32 to get off the final over.
full on off, driven to long-off.
short on the body, limp pull goes nowhere.
short on the body, fierce pull behind square from Nurse, about 7 balls too late.
full otuside off, driven past extra cover and beats the sweeper. Cosmetic adjustments to the final margin being made by Nurse.
another short ball on the body, tickles a pull past short fine leg. Makes you wonder why they were content to pat out dot balls and turn down runs last over....
another firm drive to a full ball on off beats mid-off, but it's all in vain.
